body.p: The MCP (Multi-Command Panel) options allow you to customize the behavior and appearance of the panel to suit your workflow. The following options are available in the MCP settings dialog:

dd.p: When enabled, the MCP panel will automatically open each time the application starts. Disable this option if you prefer to open the panel manually.
If checked, the MCP will restore the last used layout and arrangement of commands when reopened. Uncheck to always start with the default layout.
Displays helpful tooltips when hovering over commands in the panel. This can assist new users in understanding the function of each command.
When selected, only command icons are shown in the panel, hiding the text labels. This provides a more compact view.
Adjusts the transparency of the MCP panel. Use the slider to set the desired opacity level, from fully opaque to semi-transparent.
Restores all MCP options to their original default settings. Use this if you want to undo all customizations.

body.p: After adjusting the options, click OK to apply your changes or Cancel to discard them.
